comments.body: This idea is cool but a giant mountain that crazy but we should put a goblin monster and a goblin town and you have to wear the monster goblin skin like armor to trade if not they attack you
I hope you realize that a Tarrasque is THE most powerful monster in D&D. The Ender dragon is meant to be the main boss, so adding something like this would kind of defeat the purpose.
I think that this would be awesome but would also totally break minecraft

I don't think Tarrasque is the right name but an Overworld mountain boss is a great idea imo, with the mountains getting updated soon I would love something that could be summoned by stuff you get from mountain activities.

Maybe blowing a goats horn above a certain height would summon a boss that falls from the sky and is immune to fall damage.This means it's easiest to summon it in the mountains or mesa and is uniquely mountain-y as goats spawn in mountains too.

I think it should be immune to fire, fall damage, and weapons but not potions, netherite , and new ‚Äúmagic?‚Äù. Well I think it should spawn in a 1 in a world biome/dungeon ‚Äútarrasque mountain‚Äù and be found by eye of ender like process maybe ‚Äúlegend tracker‚Äù that needs 4 ender pearls 4 end stone and 1 nether star to craft.

Call this new mob 'Chuckers'?

'Chuckers', I would imagine, are 3 blocks tall.

They should run 25% faster then a sprinting player so they can catch up and chuck them.

Another new hostile mob: Thief.

Thieves are Illagers who will rarely spawn solo or in Village Raids.

They will, also, kidnap either villager kids and run away, or chickens. Why chickens? Why not!?

Apon death, Thieves will camp where you died, and have the chance to don your armor and take a form of weapon (any, except enchanted). When a thief is killed, it'll drop 0-2 emeralds, 5exp, and anything he stole.

The appearance of Thieves will be that akin to a Wandering trader, except grey skinned, black robed and Silver (Not gold, that look is already taken by evokers) lined.

Their sound is akin to those of previously made Illagers.
That sounds awesome,but it would be way cooler if it had a more distorted and scary appearance, kind of like the illusioner.

Saw this on reddit and I love the idea. The only mob that can even compare is the Elder Guardians jump scare, but I‚Äôm imagining this would be way cool. Since it‚Äôs supposed to be trippy, the night vision should be replaced with just making everything more saturated while being nauseous.

What loot? Maybe a 2, 3, and 4 hearts of damage instead, as you are likely to get killed by everything else already for inexperienced players. I love fighting, and love dangerous mobs. Thinking of making a longer legged spider/cricket hybrid type of thing instead, as it might look cooler. I like this.
One of the parrot skins currently in the game is a cockatiel, which is a type of cockatoo.
I was honestly a bit disappointed to find out that cockatoos are not one of the parrot color variants. I 1000% support this.
That's a very good idea but I would be hard to the parrot to follow you al through a mine or a forest. We all know that in Minecraft the animals can't follow you very well.

is gud idea
I wholeheartedly agree with this suggestion. As you said, the first wolves tamed by humans approached human camps in search for food and shelter.
This is a cool mob but it should have a unique drop or something

Yeah. I just can't really think of what it could drop and what the uses would be for. Plus rain/lightning storms don't happen all that much. So the drop should be something with a heavier impact, like crafting an item with a prolonged use rather than some potion ingredient that is instant and 1 time use. But what mechanic could we use from a drop of an elemental mob? What kind of item would we craft? I don't want it to be a weapon or armor.  Like you said, a unique item. I want it to be used for importance rather than convenience as well. So I am giving it some time to think over.
I think he can have 7% chances to drop new weapon or bow with thunderstuck enchant
I don't think that cartoony spiders should be added.
What? These all are real exept the creeper one what do you mean cartoony
Nice idea! Do you know the Boos in Mario? What if there was a spider variation that turned invisible whenever you're looking at it, but goes to attack you when you don't look at it.
The happy face spider is a little cartoony.  Not trying to be offensive.

instead of making it completely passive maybe make it so that it will not be aggressive anymore but it will still be aggressive at you if you punch the golem/villager

This would be awesome!

Maybe for horses this could look like a wearable banner on the back (like the ones illager raiding parties wear), and for llamas & mules/donkeys it could look like a hanging banner on either side? (If the banners are upright on the back of the horse, though, that may interfere with banners that JE players can wear on their heads. Maybe it would be hidden while riding a horse, OR would it just be moved onto the horse?)

I wonder how it'd be equipped... Would you just right click it onto the horse and it would be on there until the horse died? Could you replace it with another banner, and the original one would just drop? Or would it be a whole other inventory slot?
Yes but tamable and no dying tameable with bugs because they are Real and eat bugs

Yes excellent

- Seagulls always emerge over deep water (at least 3 blocks), - Crows always over land at great heights. Crows and seagulls have a very broad spectrum of loot, ranging from feathers, fish and rotten meat, to gold nuggets, ender pearls, ..., to shards of prismaries. The prey table of both is slightly different. But a lot is extremely rare. - You shouldn't be able to breed both

Or even it integrates itself into nether bricks, and when you take damage, a bunch of blocks around you break at the same time. This would make the nether...very perilous.
I hate it when I get attacked by zombies while my dogs sit there and watch me get tortured. If they could wander around without me having to worry about them following me would be great!
That would be great, kingfishers are one of my favourite birds! As someone who lives around them, they really are such beautiful creatures and I would love to see them in Minecraft.

so u only want one zombie type. Why is it bad having more it‚Äôs not like it‚Äôs either making a new zombie or a new biome
I agree, we already have too many, I mean the husk was like"oh thats cool a zombie that can survive in the sun" but drowned were kinda more like "oh, it's a zombie, it's swimming"
it is fun to have more zombies
it is fun to have more zombies

I don't agree with you games are supposed to be challenging and cool new mobs are the kings of updates this is why 1.15 and 1.16 has new mobs zombies need to have cool stuff 1.17 should be the zombie update with lots of new zombies and cool stuff so yeah that ideas kinda poopy

Making more Zombie types doesn't add more Zombies to the world, it just makes more variations. Which adds variety... in other words, it's more interesting (When Husks spawn, they spawn instead of a Zombie).

Most mobs aren't dangerous at all if you know how to actually play the game correctly. In fact, most players want the game to be more challenging! Why would you ever want only ONE zombie type???

(Drowned can swim. Husks inflict Hunger. They ARE different).
This, my friend is a humble request. And I hope it happens, so I'm gonna vote. Plus I'm a big Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy fan. :P
So long! and thanks for all the fish, also if you kill one while in the process of escaping you get the achievement "The meaning of life and everything!"
Yeah no. It would be copyright and unnecessary. They also seem to try to be somewhat realistic and flying dolphins is definitely unrealistic.

If they wanted to be realistic, dolphins would be the bad guys.
Guys, you can post comments here to tell me your ideas of how to improve the Grimm Reaper mob.
it's too violent for minecraft remember it's a kids game!
@Lotsofanimals it is rated 10+ and the nether has more violence then that

I had a different idea of the grim reaper I wanted to post lol..

My idea was: The grim reaper is a strong mob that flies and goes through walls like a vex except it is larger (the size of a creeper), and holds an iron hoe. It has a small 1% chance to spawn where you died. However, the grim reaper will disappear after 3 mins, so if you really don‚Äôt wanna fight it just wait in the distance and you‚Äôll still have time to get your items back too. The grim reaper drops the same amount of EXP the mob spawner gives, and it has a chance to just drop an iron hoe.


While the grim reaper may not be as harsh as your idea, and you can easily cheese it by maintaining your distance, it feels like something Mojang would do... in a mob vote.
Absolutely not! That is not appropriate for the players who are kids! Why would you want this in game and also why would this only be in xbox?!
No, just no. This isn't a sci-fi alien thriller.
Even if this were E10+, There's still the copyright aspect. There is no way Mojang would Aquire rights to this character that doubles it's ESRB rating and would corrupt its style.

I think it would be awesome if you add xenomorphs because i would be in a different world than mine i would rely have fun experienceing new things in a new world and i have all of the movie's so please add the xenomorphs and the overmorphs please.
